"Oh, senpai. You came at just the right: "Um... here. Please take this."
"...You're always doing things for me. So, this is my way of saying thanks."
"Ahh, don't look at me like that. I know this kind of thing doesn't feel right coming from me, but I have to thank you somehow."

"Look, I'm giving it to you. It's fine, just take it.
...See you around, senpai."
"Received <yellow>Sharp Bomber<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Penetrating Arrow<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Synthesizer<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Torrential Arrow<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Synthesizer<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Gravity Point<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Synthesizer<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Kamikaze Arrow<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Synthesizer<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Master Shot<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Photon Sphere<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Torrential Arrow<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Excube<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Extreme Pass<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Tritt Shooter<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Tri Boost +50%<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Ability Success Rate +10%<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Grind Risk Reduction (+2)<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Final Nemesis<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow>Million Storm<c> from Io."
"Received <yellow><%skit_text><c> from Io."
"Hm? What is it, senpai? You look like you want something."
"If you have a question for me, I'll do my best to answer it."

"What did you say? Could I see myself in an interracial relationship?
...What exactly are you trying to ask me, senpai?"
"Hmm, I think you're up to something, senpai. You've got some ulterior motive. Fine, I'll give you an answer."
"I guess... I wouldn't mind being with someone of another race."
"I mean, I'm a Dewman, after all. There aren't exactly many like me to choose from in the first place."
"Besides, if I fell in love with someone, I'd like to think their race or their appearance wouldn't matter..."
"...Ahh, what the heck am I saying?! Senpai, forget everything you just heard! This didn't happen! Oh, this is so embarrassing..."
"Hey, senpai... Huh? You have a question for me? Sure, if it'll help you out. Ask away."
"Huh? You want me to tell you what I do to stay on good terms with so many people...?"
"I'm not that good at socializing. Although, for some reason, people keep asking me to help them promote their class..."

"...Ughhh...!
Sorry, senpai. Just remembering it made me cringe...!"
"Huh...? You think it's because I listen to people and take them seriously, so I seem reliable? Well, if you say so, I guess that must be it."
"There aren't many other Dewmans around here, huh? Are they all out on missions?"
"There's a lot of tall people around, so my neck gets tired from looking up all the time."

"I wish I could be just a little taller...
Oh, well."
"I don't mind being a Dewman, but sometimes I catch people staring at me."
"Maybe it would be better if I hid my horns with a hat for the time being."
"My hat? Oh, I stopped wearing that pretty quickly. I realized I actually prefer standing out."

"It's good to get noticed, even if it means people look at me funny.
...It is a little embarrassing, though."
"...The other day, a stranger approached me, and we got into a long conversation about fashion. She was really beautiful."

"She didn't seem at all worried about looking weird.
...Maybe I'm too self-conscious."
"Watching the way strong people fight can be very helpful. it's fun to figure out their moves little by little."
"When I think about how they used to be like me, and how much they've improved since then, it motivates me to keep training myself."
"I don't expect to get strong. I just don't want to stay weak."
"There's a nasty feeling in the air. Even I can tell."
"So... that was Dark Falz? It was way more powerful than I expected."
"Could you imagine if it had been at full power? We wouldn't have stood a chance."
"That berserk dragon is a hot topic right now, but I've never seen it, so I don't have anything to tell you."
"If it's berserk, does that mean it attacks everything around it, no matter where it goes?"
"A Battle Championship? I'm not really interested. I'll stick to the sidelines."
"I don't really like getting too much attention."
"We Dewmans are a little weak defensively, so we have an easier time if we're in a party."
"...I usually work solo, though, so it's not a hard and fast rule."
"Why do I fight alone? Because it's easier that way."
"It's not that I hate other people. I'll work with them if I have to, and I'm not afraid to talk to people."

"It's just that I tend to talk to myself.
...It's kind of embarrassing."
"I often see you talking with all kinds of people, senpai. You have a lot of friends in ARKS, don't you?"

"I'm more comfortable on my own, but it can get a bit lonely.
...I'm a little jealous."
"...What's up with that expression? You think I'm weird, don't you? Oh, no, I knew this would happen!"
"Would I like to talk to other ARKS more? No, I'm alright as I am now. That's not really my kind of thing."
"I didn't join ARKS to make friends. I prefer to keep myself to myself."
"Besides, I have you to talk to, senpai."
"...I've got a bad feeling about this. I can't say what it is exactly, but I'm feeling really uncomfortable."
"...You seem alright though, senpai. You're not gonna go suddenly disappearing on me, are you?"
"Being able to talk to you has been really helpful. If I lost you... things would get a lot harder for me."
"...Oh! Senpai, you're safe! Thank goodness..."
"Haha... I'm so relieved, I'm actually feeling a bit faint. I don't know what to say."

"Senpai... thank you so much. Being able to see you again, to talk to you like this...
It makes me so happy."
"The mood in ARKS has changed a surprising amount recently. You think so too, right, senpai?"
"It feels like they've been more open when they communicate with us, right? I'm usually alone, so I pick up on these things."

"Is it because of what you did six months ago?
...I think I like it better this way."
"Recently, I've been talking to more people aside from you."
"I'm still not very good at talking to people, but... I don't think it's been going too badly."
"But talking to you is easier. I feel like I can speak more freely. So, come talk to me any time you like."
"Hey, senpai. If you've got a minute, want to hang out and talk?"
"...N-no, I didn't have anything in mind. There's nothing to worry about, I just wanted to talk to you."
"You don't have to treat me like a little kid. I'm fine, really."
"Yo, senpai. Huh? You're wondering why I'm not with Patty and Tea today?"
"You saw what happened last time. Why would you even have to ask me that?"

"Ahh... Just thinking about it is embarrassing...
Senpai, please just forget that ever happened..."
"Whew... O-oh, senpai. Why was I sighing? Haha, it's nothing."
"It's the first time I've had to myself for a while, so I was just relaxing. That's all."
"There's really nothing to worry about, I'm fine. Thanks for your concern, though."
"Say, where's Matoi? Are you on your own? That's rare these days."
"Ah, sorry, it's nothing. It's just, I see you two together so much, when you aren't it makes me wonder if something's happened."
"Haha, there I go, worrying about nothing. Everyone winds up alone from time to time, right? I shouldn't let it bother me."
"...Why did things have to turn out this way?"
"If only I'd been there, maybe I could have done something...."
"All I can do now is wish I had as much power as you do, senpai."
"There's a lot of things I want to say to Matoi when she comes back."
"I was really sad when I heard she'd disappeared. It felt like... like I might never be happy again."

"So, senpai...
It might sound strange coming from me, but I'll ask you anyway. Please bring Matoi back home."
"Hey, senpai! Thank goodness... I was hoping I'd run into you."
"This probably sounds strange coming from me, but... thank you. Thank you for bringing Matoi back."
"I was really glad to see her again. Thank you so, so much."
"You throw yourself into every issue around, don't you, senpai?"
"Now you're getting involved with the Lillipans too."

"I get that you're the type of person who likes to help out, but...
You should really pace yourself."

"I've been waiting for you...
Never thought I'd have a reason to say something like that. It feels like I'm facing a brand new enemy."
"For you, it's only been a few moments. But we've been waiting for a long time..."
"...Well, you're back now. And you even came to see me... I'm glad."
"I hear the Summoner class is all about fighting alongside your Pets, but I don't know what that actually looks like."
"To be honest, I don't think I'll ever be good with anything but Braver. I'm still too inexperienced to learn any new classes."
"I've been sent to investigate the Earth too."
"I've been getting a strange feeling down there, and I think I've figured out why."
"There aren't any Darkers in Tokyo. We've been fighting them for so long that not having them around feels weird."
"Is Matoi still off-duty? I guess I got used to seeing her with you, so not having her around is weird."
"She woke up about six months ago, but she went back into Cold Sleep soon after, so I didn't get much of a chance to talk to her."
"I know she's not gone for good, but it's a bit lonely without all the familiar faces around."
"I was surprised how cute Pets are. I guess it's nice to have creatures like that around."
"They seem different from Mags, somehow, but I can't place how."
"So, Hitsugi's back. She has a much more cheerful look on her face than she did before."

"I didn't want to pry, so I didn't ask her what was going on before...
Whatever it is, I'm glad it's resolved."
"Oh, senpai. Hitsugi's... I heard she's been kidnapped."
"I was worried about pushing her away, so any time she came over I stuck to casual small talk..."

"I should have been more assertive about asking if there was anything she was worried about.
...Please get her back soon."
"I'm glad Hitsugi came back safely. She came to see me herself a little while ago."
"We've had all sorts of problems here, but I'm glad you were at least able to save her. She looks more sure of herself, like she's overcome all her self-doubt."
"...Darkers really will show up anywhere, won't they?"
"Well, I guess these ones are Phantoms, so it's hard to say whether they're really Darkers."
"Either way, we can't let it slide. As ARKS, it's our main duty to protect everyone from Darkers."
"I heard you've been having a lot of difficulties. And that there was a terrible sacrifice."
"But Aru's coming back, isn't he? Then I'll be here to welcome him with a smile."
"The trouble on Earth is over, but given the history of the Photoners, there's probably something similar right around the corner."

"And we still have to do something about the [Profound Darkness]...
We've got a lot to think about."

"But you're back with us now, senpai.
...It probably sounds weird coming from me, but let's do our best out there."
"When i heard you'd gone missing, I couldn't believe it at first. I mean, there's no way you'd disappear, right senpai?"
"But the longer I went without seeing you, the more worried I got..."
"...I'm so glad you're back now. Welcome back, senpai."
"It probably doesn't mean anything, but this is the first time I've had so few missions since I joined ARKS."
"It's not like I've had nothing to do, just that I've been feeling a bit underused lately..."
"I guess if there really is nothing going on, that means we're at peace."
"...I'm sorry, senpai. You were fighting right in front of me, but I couldn't do anything to help you..."

"No, it wasn't just me...
Everyone was overwhelmed. That Goddess of Demise had us all shaking in our shoes."

",,,I've been spending all this time training to fight any opponent...
...But there's no way I can begin to fight this one."
"...Oh, senpai. I'm sorry about before. I was feeling really pathetic."
"But Xiao contacted me and told me to do what I can. He shook me out of my funk, you know?"

"So I think the best thing I can do right now is to work hard for...
For you, senpai."
"...Haha, hey senpai. I feel so pathetic, all I can do is laugh..."
"What are we supposed to do when there's no Xiao to give us orders any more..."

"You haven't given up yet, senpai...?
You think there's still a chance...?
Then I won't give up either...!"
"Senpai! You did it! This is really great news..."
"No matter what happens, we should never give up. Thank you for teaching me that, senpai!"
"When Xiao came back, I thought that we'd be back to normal in no time. I guess it wasn't to be."
"I can't help feeling down. The real battle is all still to come."
"Oh, hey senpai. I've been doing my best to support you."
"The things you're taking on are way above my pay grade, but I'm still an ARKS."

"Huh?! Valentine's worries?!
...Well, I guess if you really want to hear it..."
"There is something that's stumping me. I don't get how you're supposed to give people chocolate."
"It's better to wear something cute when you're offering it, right? So maybe I should wear... No, no, I'm fine as I am!"
"Welcome back, senpai. And thank you very much."
"That last battle... it looked impossible to survive. I mean, she was Shiva, and you're just you. But you came back safe after all. I'm so relieved."
"You've been working really hard all this time. There's still a few Darkers left, but please get some rest."
